intro: Glaucium corniculatum var. squamigerum, commonly known as the squamigerous whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has hairy, linear leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. This variety is part of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms.
